text: The Criffield-Whiteley House is a private house located at 601 Main Street in Dowagiac, Michigan, United States. It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2016. The Criffield–Whiteley House was constructed in 1897. It is a 2-1/2-story Queen Anne house sitting on a rubble fieldstone foundation which is made from large, carefully fitted pieces. The house is across from a triangular city park containing the Civil War Monument. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Cass County, Michigan Category:National Register of Historic Places in Cass County, Michigan
title: Criffield-Whiteley House
